newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 24.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 24.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Relations between communist China and United States have substantial improvements.
President Lee Teng-hui asks high-ranking officials to go out and meet local people.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Zen Master Miao Tien denies allegation of fraud scandal.
Interest and foreign exchange rates fall.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Economic ministry to speed up work on Taiwan's entry to World Trade Organisation.
Lawmakers to debate revision of basic labour law.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Central bank says Taiwan dollar has no reason to fall sharply.
Far Eastern Textile to issue corporate bonds.
